alert.note: Alert for Niagara; Orleans (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 1:30PM EDT until July 29 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN NIAGARA AND NORTHERN ORLEANS COUNTIES... At 130 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported road closures due to flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Even though the heaviest rain has ended, creeks and streams can continue to rise. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albion, Newfane, Youngstown, Waterport, Lakeside Beach State Park, Point Breeze, Fort Niagara State Park, Kent, Ridgeway, Gaines, Kendall, Wilson, Lyndonville, Barker, Appleton, Knowlesville, Olcott and Ransomville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
